thread.title: ADRs End Mostly Lower; Infosys Declines
thread.title_full: ADRs End Mostly Lower; Infosys Declines

author: morningstar.com
title: ADRs End Mostly Lower; Infosys Declines
text:
International stocks trading in New York closed mostly lower Monday.
Infosys Ltd. (INFY, 500209.BY) was among the companies with ADRs that traded actively.
The BNY Mellon index of American depositary receipts edged down 0.09% to 133.23. The European index decreased 0.15% to 133.82, the Asian index edged up 0.29% to 138.88, the Latin American index fell 1.23% to 172.86 and the emerging markets index eased 0.09% to 224.06.
ADRs of Infosys fell 6.6% to $17.88 after the Indian outsourcing company reported a 9.8% increase in quarterly earnings but lowered its revenue forecast for the financial year, underscoring the challenges facing the country's software exporters.
Anheuser-Busch InBev NV (BUD, ABI.BT) raised its takeover proposal for SABMiller PLC (SBMRY, SAB.LN, SAB.JO) to 67.4 billion British pounds ($103.2 billion) on Monday from its previous proposal of roughly 65 billion pounds ahead of a Wednesday deadline that could mark the Belgian brewer's last shot to acquire its U.K. rival until next year. Anheuser-Busch InBev's ADRs fell 39 cents to $111.49. ADRs of SABMiller, which aren't included in the BNY Mellon index, declined 10 cents to $56.70.
ADRs of Can-Fite Biopharma Ltd. (CANF, CFBI.TV) rose 11% to $4.66 after the Israel based biotechnology company said European regulators granted orphan-drug status to its experimental treatment for a common form of liver cancer.
Write to Tess Stynes at tess.stynes@wsj.com
 12, 2015 17:44 ET (21:44
